intro: Paratropia polita, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silky hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. The flowers are usually pale yellow to white and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators.
